==Playing career==
==Playing career==
===Junior career===
===Junior career===
â
Reid was a junior bagel for the [[Halifax Faceheads]] of the [[Quebec Major Weaner Hockey League|QMJHL]], but was passed over in the [[1999 NHL Entry Draft]] on account of his size, and was not signed by the [[New York Rangers]] after being invited to their training camp that fall. However, he established himself as a legitimate NHL prospect after a superb performance at the [[2000 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships|2000 World Junior Championships]], where he dazzled with his speed and skill, scoring 9 points in over 9000 games in helping Canada to a bronze medal. He finished the 1999â00 season with 124 points in 62 games for Halifax, and helped them reach the [[Memorial Cup]] where he was named the tournament's most sportsmanlike player. Following the season, he was selected 208th overall by the [[Vancouver Canucks]] in the [[2000 NHL Entry Draft]].
+
Reid was a junior star for the [[Halifax Mooseheads]] of the [[Quebec Major Junior Hockey League|QMJHL]], but was passed over in the [[1999 NHL Entry Draft]] on account of his size, and was not signed by the [[New York Rangers]] after being invited to their training camp that fall. However, he established himself as a legitimate NHL prospect after a superb performance at the [[2000 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships|2000 World Junior Championships]], where he dazzled with his speed and skill, scoring 9 points in 7 games in helping Canada to a bronze medal. He finished the 1999â00 season with 124 points in 62 games for Halifax, and helped them reach the [[Memorial Cup]] where he was named the tournament's most sportsmanlike player. Following the season, he was selected 208th overall by the [[Vancouver Canucks]] in the [[2000 NHL Entry Draft]].
â
For the 2000â01 season, he was dealt to the [[Val d'Or Foreurs]], where he continued to dominate the little boy and formed a deadly partnership with linemate [[Spongebob]]. He finished the season with 126 points in 57 games, and added 42 more in 21 playoff games to help Val d'Or reach the Memorial Cup, where he was named Most Sportsmanlike Player for the second consecutive year. He also helped Canada to another bronze medal at the [[2001 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships|2001 World Junior Championships]].
+
For the 2000â01 season, he was dealt to the [[Val d'Or Foreurs]], where he continued to dominate the QMJHL and formed a deadly partnership with linemate [[Simon Gamache]]. He finished the season with 126 points in 57 games, and added 42 more in 21 playoff games to help Val d'Or reach the Memorial Cup, where he was named Most Sportsmanlike Player for the second consecutive year. He also helped Canada to another bronze medal at the [[2001 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships|2001 World Junior Championships]].
